text: Cleo () was a three-member South Korean girl group, formed in 1999. They were one of the original Korean idol girl groups and were active at the same time as Fin.K.L and S.E.S. Their debut song "Good Time", from their first studio album, was very successful. The group's second album, released in 2000, was also successful and included the songs "Ready For Love", "Always in My Heart", and "Mosun" (; lit. "Contradiction"). Cleo's third album, which included the song "Triple", was released in 2001. Their fourth album was released in 2003, included the tracks "Donghwa" (; lit. "Fairy Tale") and "S.P.Y". Their fifth album, Rising Again, was released in 2004 and included the song "In and Out". The group disbanded in 2005. In November 2011, the three original members reunited to appear on an episode of SBS Plus' Comeback Show Top 10. In June 2016, Jung Ye-bin (now using her real name, Kong Seo-young), Chae Eun-jung, and Kim Ha-na appeared on Two Yoo Project Sugar Man, performing "Good Time". ==Members== * Kim Ha-na (김하나) * Park Ye-eun (박예은) * Chae Eun-jung (채은정) * Han Hyun-jung (한현정) * Jung Ye-bin (정예빈) ===Timeline=== ImageSize = width:450 height:170 PlotArea = width:350 height:120 left:80 bottom:30 Alignbars = justify DateFormat = yyyy Period = from:1999 till:2005 TimeAxis = orientation:horizontal format:yyyy Colors = id:Inactive value:rgb(0,0,0) legend:Inactive ScaleMajor = unit:year increment:1 start:1999 gridcolor:black PlotData = color:blue width:10 textcolor:black align:left anchor:from bar:Kim Ha-na from:start till:end bar:Park Ye-eun from:1999 till:2000 bar:Chae Eun- jung from:1999 till:2004 bar:Han Hyun-jung from:2000 till:end bar:Jung Ye-bin from:2004 till:end ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" !
